fields.name: isBlocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the access to the gateway account is blocked

fields.name: isEmailConfirmed
fields.description: Indicates whether the gateway account's e-mail has been confirmed or not.

fields.name: joystreamAccount
fields.description: Blockchain (joystream) account associated with the gateway account

fields.name: membership
fields.description: On-chain membership associated with the gateway account

fields.name: referrerChannelId
fields.description: ID of the channel which referred the user to the platform

fields.name: registeredAt
fields.description: Time when the gateway account was registered

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user associated with the gateway account (the Gateway Account Owner)

fields.name: ammInitPrice
fields.description: the amm intercept parameter b in the formula a * x + b

fields.name: ammSlopeParameter
fields.description: the amm slope parameter a in the formula a * x + b

fields.name: burnedByAmm
fields.description: quantity bought on the market by the amm

fields.name: pricePaid
fields.description: total HAPI paid/received for the quantity

fields.name: platforms
fields.description: List of platforms on which the app will be available, e.g. [mobile, web, native]

fields.name: websiteUrl
fields.description: Url where user can read more about the project or company for this app

fields.name: bids
fields.description: All bids made during this auction

fields.name: buyNowPrice
fields.description: Price at which the auction gets completed instantly (if any)

fields.name: nftOwner
fields.description: Nft owner at the time it was being auctioned.

fields.name: nftOwner
fields.description: Nft owner at the time it was being auctioned.

fields.name: nftOwner
fields.description: Nft owner at the time the auction was being auctioned.

fields.name: plannedEndAtBlock
fields.description: Block when auction is supposed to end

fields.name: displayOrder
fields.description: order in which the benefits is displayed

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the block the bid was created at

fields.name: createdInBlock
fields.description: Block in which the bid was placed

fields.name: indexInBlock
fields.description: Index in block of the related AuctionBidMade event

fields.name: previousTopBid
fields.description: Bid that was displaced by this bid in the English auction (if any)

fields.name: previousNftOwner
fields.description: NFT owner before the auction was completed

fields.name: actor
fields.description: Content actor acting as NFT owner.

fields.name: nft
fields.description: The NFT for which the buy now offer was canceled

fields.name: nftOwner
fields.description: Owner of the NFT at the time the buy now offer was canceled.

fields.name: actor
fields.description: Content actor acting as NFT owner.

fields.name: nftOwner
fields.description: NFT owner at the time it was on sale

fields.name: bannedMembers
fields.description: List of members blocked from commenting/reacting on any video of the channel.

fields.name: channelStateBloatBond
fields.description: Value of channel state bloat bond fee paid by channel creator

fields.name: channelWeight
fields.description: Weight/Bias of the channel affecting video relevance in the Homepage

fields.name: coverPhoto
fields.description: Channel's cover (background) photo asset. Recommended ratio: 16:9.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the block the channel was created at

fields.name: createdInBlock
fields.description: Number of the block the channel was created in

fields.name: creatorToken
fields.description: Token issued by channel if any

fields.name: cumulativeRevenue
fields.description: Cumulative total revenue coming from nft sales + member payments + council payouts

fields.name: cumulativeReward
fields.description: Cumulative rewards paid to this channel

fields.name: cumulativeRewardClaimed
fields.description: Cumulative rewards claimed by this channel

fields.name: followsNum
fields.description: Number of active follows (to speed up orderBy queries by avoiding COUNT aggregation)

fields.name: isCensored
fields.description: Flag signaling whether a channel is censored.

fields.name: isExcluded
fields.description: Whether a channel has been excluded/hidden (by the gateway operator)

fields.name: isPublic
fields.description: Flag signaling whether a channel is public.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The primary langauge of the channel's content

fields.name: ownerMember
fields.description: Current member-owner of the channel (if owned by a member)

fields.name: revenueShareRatioPercent
fields.description: % of channel balance that the creator devotes to revenue shares

fields.name: rewardAccount
fields.description: Channel's reward account, storing the income from the nft sales and channel payouts.

fields.name: totalVideosCreated
fields.description: Number of videos ever created in this channel

fields.name: videoViewsNum
fields.description: Number of total video views (to speed up orderBy queries by avoiding COUNT aggregation)

fields.name: yppStatus

fields.name: pricePerUnit

fields.description: total amount of token on sale

fields.description: amount of tokens that has been sold

fields.name: account
fields.description: Account associated with the session (if any)

fields.description: Browser (as deterimned based on user-agent header)

fields.description: Device (as deterimned based on user-agent header)

fields.description: Device type (as deterimned based on user-agent header)

fields.name: cipherIv

fields.name: session

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: expiry
fields.description: When does the token expire or when has it expired

fields.name: id
fields.description: The token itself (32-byte string, securely random)

fields.name: issuedFor
fields.description: The account the token was issued for

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the token (its intended purpose)

fields.name: revenueShareParticipation
fields.description: information about token account's participation in revenue shares

fields.name: stakedAmount
fields.description: staked amount, to avoid walking to split participations

fields.name: token
fields.description: token for which the account is created

fields.name: totalAmount
fields.description: total token amount (not necessarely liqud) for the account

fields.name: vestingSchedules
fields.description: vesting schedule info, it can be empty if no vesting schedules are pending

fields.name: token
fields.description: token reference, unique as one token cannot have multiple trailers

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price that the member should pay to accept offer (optional)

fields.name: account
fields.description: The account associated with the user (if any)

fields.name: isRoot
fields.description: Whether the user has root (gateway operator) privileges

fields.name: nftFeaturingRequests
fields.description: NFT featuring requests associated with the user

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: List of all the gateway operator permissions that this user has

fields.name: videoViewEvents
fields.description: Video views associated with the user

fields.name: dayTimestamp
fields.description: Timestamp of the day that is used to count the interactions

fields.name: entityId
fields.description: ID of the entity that the event is related to for 'tokenMarketplaceEntry' it would be token ID

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the user interaction eg. 'tokenMarketplaceEntry'

fields.name: totalVestingAmount
fields.description: total amount the schedule is vested

fields.name: cliffRatioPermill
fields.description: Permill of amount vested immediately after cliff period

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the block the video was created at

fields.name: createdInBlock
fields.description: Block the video was created in

fields.name: hasMarketing
fields.description: Whether or not Video contains marketing

fields.name: includeInHomeFeed
fields.description: Optional boolean flag to indicate if the video should be included in the home feed/page.

fields.name: isCensored
fields.description: Flag signaling whether a video is censored.

fields.name: isCommentSectionEnabled
fields.description: Is comment section enabled (true if enabled)

fields.name: isExcluded
fields.description: Whether a video has been excluded/hidden (by the gateway operator)

fields.name: isExplicit
fields.description: Whether the Video contains explicit material.

fields.name: isPublic
fields.description: Whether the Video is supposed to be publically displayed

fields.name: isReactionFeatureEnabled
fields.description: Is reactions feature enabled on video (true if enabled i.e. video can be reacted)

fields.name: isShort
fields.description: Whether the video is a short format, vertical video (e.g. Youtube Shorts, TikTok, Instagram Reels)

fields.name: isShortDerived
fields.description: Whether the video is a short format, vertical video, and it derived based on video dimension (i.e. was not set in metadata)

fields.name: license
fields.description: License under the video is published

fields.name: publishedBeforeJoystream
fields.description: If the Video was published on other platform before beeing published on Joystream - the original publication date

fields.name: trailerVideoForToken
fields.description: token for which this video is trailer

fields.name: videoRelevance
fields.description: Video relevance score based on the views, reactions, comments and update date

fields.name: videoStateBloatBond
fields.description: Value of video state bloat bond fee paid by channel owner

fields.name: viewsNum
fields.description: Number of video views (to speed up orderBy queries by avoiding COUNT aggregation)

fields.name: assetIds
fields.description: IDs of video assets being deleted by moderator

fields.name: deletedBy
fields.description: Actor who deleted the video assets.

fields.name: rationale
fields.description: why the video assets were deleted

fields.name: isSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the category is supported by the Gateway

fields.name: memberHandle
fields.description: handle for the member that dropped the dislike

fields.name: memberId
fields.description: id for the member that dropped the dislike

fields.name: videoTitle
fields.description: video title used for notification text

fields.name: category
fields.description: Category the video is featured in

fields.name: videoCutUrl
fields.description: Url to video fragment to be displayed in the UI

fields.name: activatedAt
fields.description: Time at which this VideoHero was created/activated

fields.name: heroPosterUrl
fields.description: Url to the poster to be displayed in the Hero section

fields.name: heroVideoCutUrl
fields.description: Url to video fragment to be displayed in the Hero section

fields.name: video
fields.description: Video being featured in the Hero section

fields.name: memberHandle
fields.description: handle for the member that dropped the like

fields.name: memberId
fields.description: id for the member that dropped the like

fields.name: codecName
fields.description: Encoding of the video media object

fields.name: encoding
fields.description: Encoding of the video media object

fields.name: channelId
fields.description: id for the channel used in link construction

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the block the reaction was created at

fields.name: video
fields.description: The video that has been reacted to

fields.name: count
fields.description: No of times the video has been reacted with given reaction

fields.name: asset
fields.description: Storage object representing the subtitle file

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: MIME type description of format used for this subtitle

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the video view event

fields.name: videoId
fields.description: ID of the video that was viewed (the video may no longer exist)

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
